Why might antivirus software flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Antivirus software like Avast and Kaspersky may flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" (potentially unwanted program) because it is mining software, which can be installed by a third party to exploit a user's PC. This is a false positive, and the software is not malware. More information about these false positives can be found in resources provided by Malwarebytes and Kaspersky.

How can I verify the safety of the software?

You can verify the safety of the software by checking the VirusTotal links provided for each platform (MacOS, Linux-AMD64, Linux-ARM64, and Windows). These links will show the detection results from various antivirus software, which can help you determine if the software is safe to use.
